ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Migraine
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Supported by history of migraine with aura, vertigo, and response to migraine prophylaxis; significant overlap with Meniere's.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Meniere's Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Suggested by low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, roaring tinnitus, and episodic vertigo.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hormonally Mediated Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Strong correlation of symptom fluctuation with menstrual cycle and significant hearing improvement during pregnancies.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Autoimmune Inner Ear Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to fluctuation, but the pattern of improvement during pregnancy rather than progression makes it less likely.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and monitor significant fluctuations over time.
To evaluate speech recognition abilities, which fluctuate alongside pure-tone thresholds.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Baseline evaluation showing bilateral asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss with a low-frequency component in the right ear and mild loss in the left. Speech recognition is good bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate SNHL 250-1000 Hz, improving to normal at 2000-3000 Hz, sloping to mild-moderate at high frequencies (PTA 30 dB HL). Left ear: Mild low-frequency SNHL rising to normal (PTA 15 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 30 dB, WRS 72-92%. Left SRT 15 dB, WRS 92%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up 16 months later showing significant worsening of thresholds in both ears, particularly in the low-to-mid frequencies for the left ear.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Worsened at 3000-4000 Hz and 8000 Hz (PTA 40 dB HL). Left ear: Significantly poorer from 250-8000 Hz (PTA 45 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 40 dB, WRS 92%. Left SRT 45 dB, WRS 80%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Evaluation during first pregnancy (31 weeks) revealing significant improvement in the right ear, consistent with hormonal influence.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Significant improvement to near-normal thresholds (PTA 10 dB HL). Left ear: Stable moderate loss (PTA 40 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 10 dB, WRS 96%. Left SRT 40 dB, WRS 86%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Post-partum evaluation (3 months after delivery) showing regression of hearing in the right ear following the birth.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Worsened significantly at 1000 Hz and 3000-8000 Hz compared to pregnancy (PTA 30 dB HL). Left ear: Relatively unchanged (PTA 40 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 30 dB, WRS 90%. Left SRT 40 dB, WRS 84%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Routine follow-up 20 months later. Thresholds are stable, but left ear word recognition has deteriorated significantly.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Air conduction thresholds relatively unchanged. Right PTA 30 dB HL, Left PTA 50 dB HL.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Evaluation during second pregnancy (24 weeks) again showing significant improvement in the right ear, while the left ear remains poorer with reduced speech recognition.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Significantly improved thresholds 250-8000 Hz (PTA 15 dB HL). Left ear: Stable moderate-severe loss (PTA 60 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 15 dB, WRS 96%. Left SRT 60 dB, WRS 45-60%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Post-partum evaluation (4 months after second delivery) showing worsening in the right ear again. Left ear speech recognition improved slightly.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Significantly poorer from 250-1500 Hz and 6000-8000 Hz (PTA 40 dB HL). Left ear: Stable (PTA 50 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 40 dB, WRS 84%. Left SRT 50 dB, WRS 72%.

proposed_items: Dietary modifications including salt and caffeine restriction.
Medical management with diuretics (e.g., HCTZ/triamterene) and migraine prophylaxis (e.g., Paxil, Topamax).
Bilateral amplification with digital hearing aids (initially BTE, later RIC) featuring volume control and multiple programs to manage fluctuation.
Use of hearing-assistive technologies such as Bluetooth streamers and FM systems.
Regular audiologic monitoring every 6 to 12 months.
counseling_actions: Educate on the link between hormonal changes (menstrual cycle, pregnancy) and symptom fluctuation.
Discuss the overlap between Vestibular Migraine and Meniere's Disease.
Counsel on realistic expectations for hearing aids given the fluctuating nature of the hearing loss.

escalation.rationale_short: To manage vestibular migraine/Meniere's symptoms and rule out retrocochlear pathology (MRI/CT were performed).

follow_up_plan.objective: To monitor hearing thresholds and reprogram hearing aids as needed due to fluctuation.

expected_outcome: Hormonal treatment attempts for hearing loss were not successful.
Vertigo is currently resolved and headaches occur approximately once a month with medical management (alprazolam, nortriptyline, Paxil, magnesium, B2).
Hearing loss remains relatively stable at this time.
Successfully fitted with bilateral digital Receiver-In-the-Canal (RIC) hearing aids with custom molds.
Patient reports significant improvement with hearing aids and successfully uses a Bluetooth streamer.
